top_comments_top.body: Why do people say it has sexualized children? Never heard of the game before

I've been playing this game for about a year, have spent $10 and it got me no where lol

With that said, I have no issues progressing through the game as a F2P player on 2 accounts and only struggle with Abyss and some of the really challenging events that pop up. Content releases, new characters, and events are more than enough to keep the casual player busy (I have time to play 1-2 hours a few days a week).

I truly love this game and think it's really special. I've tried to convince some of my hardcore gamer friends to play and they all call it a slot machine and a grind.... These are some of the same people that have been playing WOW for like 10 years, didn't mind paying for the games and expansions, monthly fees, etc. It blowsy mind.

top_comments_best.body: Why do people say it has sexualized children? Never heard of the game before

I've been playing this game for about a year, have spent $10 and it got me no where lol

With that said, I have no issues progressing through the game as a F2P player on 2 accounts and only struggle with Abyss and some of the really challenging events that pop up. Content releases, new characters, and events are more than enough to keep the casual player busy (I have time to play 1-2 hours a few days a week).

I truly love this game and think it's really special. I've tried to convince some of my hardcore gamer friends to play and they all call it a slot machine and a grind.... These are some of the same people that have been playing WOW for like 10 years, didn't mind paying for the games and expansions, monthly fees, etc. It blowsy mind.

Game was near perfect. From launch to 1.6 

2.0 updates are not. New enemies are obviously unbalanced. Story is rushed. Forcing players to wait for another day to do certain world Quests (not events) is just a cheap attempt at drip feeding content.

But the community? Oof, they're everything that is wrong with this game. The toxic bunch I mean. I once get overly attacked by toxic morons for making a post in the guide section to help newbies.

Genshin Impact has potential, but the company miHoYo is screwing up badly as of late. Other than that, game is perfectly playable without needing to spend a dime on it.

No. You can argue that it's simliar to Zelda, but play for a while and you'll see eventually that they're a heck ton different. Those who claim its a rip off are merely people who never played the game.

Also people who never played a Gacha or have a problem spending money on games would blame Genshin Impact for being "P2W", while in reality money won't help you progress much at all in the game. You still to have to grind to upgrade weapons and characters.

Also no point in the game do you get told to spend money or get certain characters. That's up to you.

Edit: So many typos.

Pretty sure Number 2 is just a by-product of the community being degenerate haha.

The game is fantastic, wouldn't recommend sinking money into it, just play it like a very fast JRPG, or if gacha runs in your blood throw your money at it. I quit a while back, but I'm pretty sure I'll be back when newer regions and stuff are available.
